# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can solve this problem in Julia language by using several built-in functions. The function `lowercase`, `strip` and `replace` can be used to achieve the desired result.
Here is a simple implementation:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(strip(lowercase(col)), " " => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the string into lower case using `lowercase` and then removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`. It replaces all spaces with underscores using `replace`.
